name: Coffee Table

For safety reasons, we are looking to replace it with a sturdy table that does not come with any storage. We prefer a rectangular-shaped table so our boys can sit around it when studying. 

Please donate only new or in good condition tables, as they are meant to last our residents for many years to come. Thank you!

Given her current health condition and financial strain, client would benefit greatly from receiving Pull Up L-Sized Adult Diapers and Underpads to reduce the financial pressure and ensure she can manage her hygiene and medical needs. Both client and daughter are not working as their medical issues hinders them from doing so and do not have much savings – mostly reliant on government payouts for their day to day expenses and living a frugal lifestyle. 

Nonetheless, client is trying to make changes to her lifestyle to improve her health outlook, and thus is motivated to monitor her BP more often & keep track of her health. However, she does not have the funds to buy one as her expenses are set aside for daily necessities (food, bills, etc.). name: Diapers for children
description: Client stays in a 1 room HDB rental flat in Sengkang with her spouse and 2 special needs children (M/6 and F/4) who are diagnosed with autism. Due to the high needs of her children, client has her hands full with caregiving and is unable to work. Her spouse, having a past incarceration record, has problems finding employment and is currently unemployed. Due to F/4's diagnosis of low-functioning autism, she is nonverbal and is unable to voice out when she wants to use the toilet, causing client to be unable to toilet train her properly, hence she is still wearing diapers. As F/4 is severely overweight, she is unable to fit into children sized diapers, hence client is requesting for 6-8 packs of Tena Adult Diapers (size S) for F/4 to last her around 1-2 months as the family is struggling financially.
